axxo has bailed from TPB. This is official news from the norwegian tabloids (!!!) Some comment on TPB upset him and he decided to withdraw all his releases. All axxo releases on the TPB now are re-releases from other people. Axxo said in the same interview that he will continue his work on another torrent site, failed to mention which one though:(

I have a hard time axxo left the tpb becuase of bad comments? if you believe that then your stupid. Axxo has the most sought after movie torrents on the net.

It is name recognition and bash it all you want on the internet your name is all you have.  You can find axxo torrents on supermundo (something like that) and mininova (although I hate their layout).  As for the movie itself it is a decent british humor movie with nothing extreme.  Overall its not that great but it is free and everyone likes free.  Quality is superb and the movie itself I would give a 6/10 characters were rather weak for being designed to be stand out ones.  The midget was not even that great and who doesn't love to laugh at a homoerotic midget.

Ok those of you who are getting no sound need to download the AC3 sound filter. You can get the installer for that here: http://ac3filter.net/project/1/releases

current version is 1.46 and yes, its free, its not big too so is a small download and will fix your issues.

Axxo uses AC3 for almost all of his releases, also you may have noticed other films that say AC3 in the file name, this is why.

Also i recommend VLC player, as it can play most movies without the need for additional codecs as it has its own codecs built in, also you can create custom aspect ratios which is handy if a film is over letterboxed or something, you can get that here: http://www.videolan.org

And again yes its free.


Thanks for the up =]

Death at a Funeral
Opened August 17th, 2007
Directed by Frank Oz
Chaos ensues when a man tries to expose a dark secret regarding a recently deceased patriarch of a dysfunctional British family.
Why it's Great: The funniest farce and best British humor you'll see in a movie in years. Death at a Funeral takes us back to Frank Oz' comedic roots with a great film that builds momentum as time goes on and turns a typically morbid event into the most hilarious mishap ever. Fans of "Firefly" star Alan Tudyk won't be able to stop laughing once he's on the drugs - and it never lets up, it only gets better and better as the story goes on.

Read more: http://www.firstshowing.net/2007/12/24/best-19-movies-you-didnt-see-in-2007/#ixzz0m5wqPaUc
